> Since the eye input resolution is 7x7, there are 49 input nodes for
> the visual input.  We started as NEAT does, with no input nodes,

I think you mean "no hidden nodes", right?

> One thing I failed to note, but should probabably be fairly
> clear...the left window of the movie shows a top-level view of the
> behavior of the eye.  The line in the circle indicates the eye's
> orientation, and it's actually upside down and fully zoomed out at
> step 1.  The right window is what the eye is seeing as it moves
> around.  

It's also worth noting that the visual field is a square circumscribed
around the circle in the left window.  The top of the square is
perpendicular to the line segment inside the circle.
